Description: Basic format if the word is already known to the system.
Complete format if there is new information (requires initial + and $ for normalization).
Remove irrelevant alternative lemmatizations suggested by the system.
Follow the Concise Dictionary of Akkadian (CDA), even if it differs from the CAD.
Do not include mimation in CFs (but do in NORM0).
Have independent CFs even if not listed separately in CDA.
Ignore CDA parentheses but keep their content.
Use the first translation in CDA. If alternatives with slash (/), choose the first.
Words with fixed translation by historical convention.
GW or sense is always [unit].
Use convention [be(come) + adj].
Add // after GW for significant variations.
Effective Part of Speech. Marked after POS with an apostrophe if different or specific.
Classified as V'N (verb used as noun).
Classified as AJ (adjective) without EPOS.
Do not use secondary length. Keep final vowel length as if no suffix.
Not separated by hyphen in normalizations.
Normalize what is written, not intended. Mark long vowels.
Only lemmatize if starting syllabically or having phonetic complement. Otherwise leave as 'n' with POS NU.
If meaning is known but Akkadian reading unknown, logogram is citation form.
Insert +. at end of sentence (where a period would go).
Join words with & without spaces.
Treat as single orthographic unit but lemmatize parts with &.
If written logographically, use & between lemmas. Add #psu comment for glossary.
Initial capital. Hyphenate internal boundaries. DO NOT mark long vowels.
Use simple consonants instead of reduplicated.
If anthropomorphic/astro/mythological use DN. If used as common noun, use N.
Adjective (including statives).
Noun.
Verb.
Preposition.
Subjunction.
Modal, negative, or conditional particle.
Demonstrative pronoun.
Independent pronoun.
Possessive pronoun.
